Job Title: IT Systems Administrator - Classifed Programs - FULL SCOPE POLY CLEARNACE REQUIRED

Location: Reston, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Design, Information Technology

Description:
FULL SCOPE POLY Clearance - REQUIRED
Our client is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, our client is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Our client's family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, our client is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
Our client is seeking an IT Systems Administrator to directly support our most sensitive programs. You will be a part of the team building and maintaining the critical classified infrastructure. You will have the opportunity to work with and learn from some of the world’s best engineers and cybersecurity professionals as you help to implement cutting edge systems. You will work directly with customers and systems deployed across the globe in support of national security missions all while gaining invaluable experience navigating complex cybersecurity regulation frameworks.
WHAT YOU’LL DOBuild IT infrastructure at all classification levels and a variety of handling requirements (SAP, SCI) in ways that have not previously been done in classified spacesDesign, install, operate, maintain and troubleshoot classified IT systems consisting of a variety of operating systems (mainly Linux and Windows) and hardwareWork in close coordination with the ISSM and ISO in monitoring the information system(s) implementing configuration management across authorization boundariesServe as subject matter expert for classified IT matters that require escalationDefine, document and follow standards and best practices for systems design, testing, and implementationDrive scripting and automation to develop solutions to common problemsREQUIRED QUALIFICATIONSExperience managing Windows Server and Windows Active Directory; to include file and print services, DNS, Domain Controllers, and application serversFamiliar with administration of Linux-based systemsFundamental understanding of networkingExperience in unclassified, internet exposed environments to inform parity of classified environmentsUnderstanding of basic security best-practices and hardening of Microsoft environmentsExperience working with virtualized infrastructure (e.g., ESXi, Linux KVM, Hyper-V, Docker)Previous experience deploying IT systems from scratchMust possess and be able to maintain a U.S. TS Security clearancePREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSPrevious support to classified IT systemsExperience with a scripting language (Bash, Python, etc.) to automate and solve reoccurring tasksActive TS/SCI/ISSA Clearance

Experience Level (if available): Director
